wikipedia_page.main: Frank Charles Hodges (26 January 1891 – 5 June 1985) was an English footballer. His regular position was as a forward. He was born in Nechells, Birmingham. He played League football for Birmingham, Manchester United, Wigan Borough and Crewe Alexandra, and also made wartime guest appearances for St Mirren.

response: * Frank Hodges (trade unionist) (1887–1947), English trade union leader, General Secretary of the Miners' Federation of Great Britain
* Frank Hodges (trade unionist) (1887–1947), English trade union leader and Member of Parliament
